author: gerard
post: First of all greetings everyone and a very merry and traditional Christmas to all. I have been a Shroudie since I was 10 yrs old. I have read or watched just about all the many papers, books and film on the subject. Yannick, to me your argument is “(The image is) OBVIOUSLTY THAT OF JESUS DEAD AFTER HIS PASSION. Where do you see signs of life (glorious or not) there???” Why could not the moment of resurrection record the state of the corpse? Perhaps at the moment of dematerialisation? The image on the cloth shows a dead body. The image exists because of the resurrection event. Science has proven the first but so far has not disproven the second. Is it wrong to believe this?.
title: Is it absurd to think that the Shroud can show a physical trace of the Resurrection?
